comments.raw_text: Right now, bookmarklets in your bookmarks toolbar are drawn with the dotted "no favicon" icon next to them. This looks sloppy. We should special-case these, either by not drawing an icon at all or by using some kind of special "Do something cool" icon we provide.

comments.raw_text: Could this not hinder extensions like https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/bookmark-favicon-changer/ from allowing us to pick our own favicons please?

Since bookmarklets (starting with javascript:) are things that are tools rather than websites, it feels like we should just drop the favicon for bookmarklets specifically rather than showing an empty one.

Mardeg, AFAIK this wouldn't change any of what that extension does, but feel free to let me know if it has any non-obvious functionality.
